Class Main

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
application.Main
public class Main extends javafx.application.Application
Entry point of the game application and central navigation manager.

This class is responsible for:

  • Creating the shared DeckPool and GameController
  • Initializing the primary JavaFX stage and main scene
  • Swapping UI views such as Start Menu, Battle, Reward, Stage Clear, and Congratulation screens

The application uses a single Scene whose root node is replaced to perform lightweight view transitions without reconstructing the entire JavaFX window.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      JavaFX application entry point.

      This method initializes all core game components:

      • Creates the DeckPool
      • Creates the GameController
      • Loads and displays the StartMenuView
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - the primary stage created by the JavaFX runtime

    • showStartMenu

      public void showStartMenu()
      Navigates to the start menu screen. Replaces the scene root with a fresh StartMenuView.

    • showBattleScreen

      public void showBattleScreen()
      Navigates to the battle gameplay screen. Replaces the scene root with a new BattleView.

    • showRewardScreen

      public void showRewardScreen()
      Navigates to the reward selection screen after miniboss encounters. Alias of showRewardView().

    • showRewardView

      public void showRewardView()
      Navigates to the reward selection view. Replaces the scene root with RewardView.

    • showStageClearView

      public void showStageClearView()
      Navigates to the stage-cleared screen, displayed after defeating normal enemies.

    • showCongratView

      public void showCongratView()
      Navigates to the final congratulations (victory) screen.

    • exitGame

      public void exitGame()
      Closes the application window and exits the game.

      public GameController getController()

      the game's central controller
